job_title: Full-Time Instructor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Work life balance Good pay Good hours
cons: Sometimes communication is lacking between admin and faculty

job_title: Academic Advisor in Peoria, IL
pros: Great benefits, wonderful students to work with.
cons: Low salary, little room for advancement, heavy workload, no tuition reimbursement for long term grant funded positions.

job_title: Professor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Faulty and staff are dedicated and incredible
cons: Upper administration is absolutely not

job_title: Faciilities & Construction Manager in East Peoria, IL
pros: Very good place to work. Great management and support staff.
cons: Just like anywhere else sometimes just need more employees to cover all the work.

job_title: Manager, Enrollment in Peoria, OK
pros: Multiple opportunities to contribute to the organization; Students need and appreciate assistance
cons: Education industry salaries are low

job_title: Supplemental Instructions (SI) Leader in East Peoria, IL
pros: You get to make your schedule, work with professors, and the team is amazing.
cons: The number of hours for working are fine for a student but not for a part-time job.

job_title: Specialist in East Peoria, IL
pros: Benefits, people, and room to grow
cons: commute, people, and not always hiring

job_title: Tutor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Good place to work as a student. Significant paid down time on the job. Other employees are either neutral or friendly. Students are generally easy to deal with.
cons: Sometimes students abuse the tutoring service by basically just asking tutors for the answers. This does not happen the majority of the time but is significant.

job_title: Anatomy Physiology Instructor in Peoria, IL
pros: Wonderful students, strong curriculum, Great Professors/ Instructors
cons: Can't think of a thing

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Peoria, IL
pros: Great health benefits with low premiums, nice vacation, sick and personal days.
cons: Quite “top heavy” (lots of VPs). Compensation is not what I would call competitive by any means. Not much room for growth for most positions. “Additional duties as assigned” is used broadly and quite frankly, abused.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Peoria, IL
pros: I appreciated the support as a new instructor.
cons: Parking in a lot far from school

job_title: Adjunction Professor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Great colleagues, Good sense of Camaraderie in the Department of Arts & Communication, Mentoring environment
cons: Adjunct pay is minimal if you are really putting in a significant effort to teach, assess, and connect with your students.  The number of hours it takes to stay current and effective in teaching is underestimated based on the rate of pay. But they do at least provide opportunities to advance the base pay but it requires putting in more hours that you aren't being paid for.  You have to independently participate on committees, continue your education, etc. on your own time and your own dime to periodically (after 60 hours) earn an increase to your base pay.

review_title: As a long time employee of ICC I have to rate ICC as an excellent place to work.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Peoria, IL
pros: Benefits, work hours, time off policies, pay, family-like atmosphere, improving employee evaluation process,
cons: Cronyism/nepotism exists, some inflexible terms of employment in some job positions, overly obsessed with liability

review_title: A wonderful school to teach at...
job_title: Instructor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Overall, ICC is very good to their adjunct faculty.  I have been with them for 23 years, and have thoroughly enjoyed the faculty, students, atmosphere.  Comparatively, I believe that we are in a higher pay range than many adjunct faculty.  We are also included in numerous meeting, committees, and projects--not mandatory, but invited.  Also, they recently paid for an online training program for me.
cons: Many of us are about to experience cutbacks in our teaching assignments, due to changes in state laws. So, I am looking for additional work in online education.

job_title: Counselor in Peoria, IL
pros: Great student interaction and plenty of need for quality people to provide direction to traditional and non-traditional learners!
cons: They're about a decade behind in discussions about racism, institutional oppression, and diversity. Even having a "diversity" director does little except reinforce (terrible) stereotypes.

review_title: Great Place to Work and Great People
job_title: International Education Coordinator in Peoria, IL
pros: Laid back work environment. Management is very active in the decisions and also allows employees to have creativity and power.
cons: With the budget cuts in Illinois , everyone is a little on edge about their position. Enrollment is not the best that it could be but everyone is working together to try to find a solution to the problem.

job_title: in Peoria, IL
pros: Hourly pay rate is pretty good.
cons: They are not making anyone full time these days and cutting all part time employees hours to little if none at all.

review_title: Smoke and Mirrors Management aside, it is a great place
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Peoria, IL
pros: Great place to work, pay good, benefits excellent. This reason alone is why I would work here.
cons: Executive management does not reflect the CORE Values they preach.

job_title: Assistant Mens Basketball Coach in East Peoria, IL
pros: Great facilities, outstanding academics. Close proximity school, housing, athletics. Faculty and staff great support for all 10 sports. Free tutoring
cons:
Division 2 not Division 1. Division 1 facilities, more trips for all sports, put more money in all 10
Sports

job_title: Adjunct Lecturer in East Peoria, IL
pros: The campus is an innovative, educational environment
cons: higher education benefits only apply at the junior college level, tuition remission is only for two courses per semester… once you leave, you forfeit all tuition benefits for dependents.

job_title: Tutor in East Peoria, IL
pros: I enjoy having students come to me who want help, and to be able to help them.
cons: Management seems much more concerned with statistics and superficials than with helping students.  They've let go excellent supervisors and replaced them with poor or mediocre ones.

review_title: Resource Tutor for College Science Courses
job_title: Middle School Science Teacher in Princeville, IL
pros: ICC offered the opportunity to work with students as they progressed toward a Nursing career.
cons: Limited hours of staffing to support the level of committed students.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Peoria, IL
pros: it is a great concept
cons: fo.r an adult learner you cant have this type of class twice a week it must be more consistent

job_title: Math Tutor in East Peoria, IL
pros:
- Flexible hours
- Can work on something else while on the clock (if nobody needs help)
cons: - Employee parking permit is not given

job_title: Instructor in Peoria, IL
pros: Good students. A good place to teach and interact.
cons: I've been offered classes months in advance, only to get bumped or have my assignment yanked at the last minute, without notice. This is "not the way it goes," but a result of bad management and poor communication.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in East Peoria, IL
pros: Students are great.  Teaching is rewarding.
cons: Recent secret "purging" of Adjuncts by Administration is not the College's finest hour. A new faculty qualification policy went into affect in September. Faculty members were not notified until Thanksgiving. Some faculty with a high level of professional experience judged "unqualified."

job_title: Director of Facilities Services in East Peoria, IL
pros: Takes care of  People
cons: No negative  that I am aware of

job_title: Administrative Assistant in East Peoria, IL
pros: Time off, vacation, sick time,
cons: Very gossipy, high school environment. No need for change.

job_title: Library Assistant in Peoria, IL
pros:
Accommodating to School schedule
Very Nice Staff
Paid Training 
Patrons very nice
cons:
Occasional bad patron 
A lot of down time

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in East Peoria, IL
pros: Flexible hours, Good Dean, Supportive Co-workers
cons: Large turnover in administration, salary isn't  great for adjuncts
